Abstract: This paper explores the advancements in spacecraft-mounted robotics, focusing on manipulators for in-orbit servicing. It discusses the control and trajectory tracking of robotic arms using dual quaternions, which offer a compact and efficient representation of rigid body motion. The dynamics and kinematics of these systems are analyzed to enhance precision and reliability in space operations, ensuring effective maintenance and assembly tasks. Simulation results and experimental validations are presented to demonstrate the robustness and accuracy of the proposed methods.
